author: Cricbuzz Staff
title: IPL 2017 Auction - Highlights | Cricbuzz.com
text:
Last updated on Mon, 20 Feb, 2017, 10:06 AM © BCCI Ben Stokes: Ben Stokes sets the auction on fire. Almost as soon as his name is announced multiple teams announce their interest. Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bangalore set the early pace before Delhi Daredevils and Sunrisers Hyderabad join the race. Eventually, it is Rising Pune Supergiant, who with a bid of 14.5 Crore INR, seal the deal for the England all-rounder. Other noteworthy picks from the All-rounders list are: Pawan Negi to RCB for 1 Crore, Angelo Mathews to Delhi Daredevils for 2 Crore and Corey Anderson moves to Delhi Daredevils for 1 Crore. More surprisingly, one time India all-round prospect and Irfan Pathan remains unsold. Specialist batsmen: So only one player sold from the first category - Specialist BatsmenEoin Morgan moves to Kings XI Punjab for INR 2 Crore. The other batsmen including Alex Hales, Saurabh Tiwary and Jason Roy among others remain unsold. They could come up again for grabs later. Build Up: 
Too much information to digest at one go? We understand... 
The IPL Auction is one hectic affair, for the players, the teams and everyone else involved. It can be the same for the viewers who's trying to keep tabs with all that is happening. So we will be picking out the main talking points from the ongoing IPL 2017 auction. © Cricbuzz
